name: CKEDITOR.editor
doc: Represents an editor instance. This constructor should be rarely used in favor of the CKEDITOR editor creation functions.

members.name: activeEnterMode
members.doc:
The dynamic enter mode which should be used in the current context (selection location). By default it equals the enterMode and it can be changed by the setActiveEnterMode method.

See also the setActiveEnterMode method for an explanation of dynamic settings.
members.short_doc: The dynamic enter mode which should be used in the current context (selection location). ...

members.name: activeFilter
members.doc:
The active filter instance which should be used in the current context (location selection). This instance will be used to make a decision which commands, buttons and other features can be enabled.

By default it equals the filter and it can be changed by the setActiveFilter method.

editor.on( 'activeFilterChange', function() {
    if ( editor.activeFilter.check( 'cite' ) )
        // Do something when <cite> was enabled - e.g. enable a button.
    else
        // Otherwise do something else.
} );

See also the setActiveEnterMode method for an explanation of dynamic settings.
members.short_doc: The active filter instance which should be used in the current context (location selection). ...

members.name: activeShiftEnterMode
members.doc: See the activeEnterMode property.

members.name: blockless
members.doc:
Indicates that the editor is running in an environment where no block elements are accepted inside the content.

This can be for example inline editor based on <h1> element.
members.short_doc:
Indicates that the editor is running in an environment where
no block elements are accepted inside the content. ...

members.name: config
members.doc:
The configurations for this editor instance. It inherits all settings defined in CKEDITOR.config, combined with settings loaded from custom configuration files and those defined inline in the page when creating the editor.

var editor = CKEDITOR.instances.editor1;
alert( editor.config.skin ); // e.g. 'moono'
members.short_doc: The configurations for this editor instance. ...

members.name: container
members.doc:
The outermost element in the DOM tree in which the editable element resides. It is provided by a specific editor creator after editor UI is created and is not intended to be modified.

var editor = CKEDITOR.instances.editor1;
alert( editor.container.getName() ); // 'span'
members.short_doc: The outermost element in the DOM tree in which the editable element resides. ...

members.name: contextMenu
dataProcessor
members.doc: If defined, points to the data processor which is responsible to translate and transform the editor data on input and output. Generaly it will point to an instance of CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor, which handles HTML data. The editor may also handle other data formats by using different data processors provided by specific plugins.
members.short_doc:
If defined, points to the data processor which is responsible to translate
and transform the editor data on input and...

members.name: document
members.doc:
The document that stores the editor contents.

  • For the classic (iframe-based) editor it is equal to the document inside the iframe containing the editable element.
  • For the inline editor it is equal to CKEDITOR.document.

The document object is available after the contentDom event is fired and may be invalidated when the contentDomUnload event is fired (classic editor only).

editor.on( 'contentDom', function() {
    console.log( editor.document );
} );
members.short_doc: The document that stores the editor contents. ...

members.name: element
members.doc: The original host page element upon which the editor is created, it's only supposed to be provided by the concrete editor creator and is not subjected to be modified.
members.short_doc:
The original host page element upon which the editor is created, it's only
supposed to be provided by the concrete ed...

members.name: elementMode
members.doc: This property indicate the way how this instance is associated with the element.@see CKEDITOR.ELEMENT_MODE_INLINE @see CKEDITOR.ELEMENT_MODE_REPLACE
members.short_doc:
This property indicate the way how this instance is associated with the element.@see CKEDITOR.ELEMENT_MODE_INLINE
@se...

members.name: enterMode
members.doc: The main (static) enter mode which is a validated version of the CKEDITOR.config.enterMode setting. Currently only one rule exists – blockless editors may have enter modes set only to CKEDITOR.ENTER_BR.
members.short_doc: The main (static) enter mode which is a validated version of the CKEDITOR.config.enterMode setting. ...

members.name: filter
members.doc:
The main filter instance used for input data filtering, data transformations, and activation of features.

It points to a CKEDITOR.filter instance set up based on editor configuration.
members.short_doc:
The main filter instance used for input data filtering, data
transformations, and activation of features. ...

members.name: focusManager
members.doc: Controls the focus state of this editor instance. This property is rarely used for normal API operations. It is mainly destinated to developer adding UI elements to the editor interface.
members.short_doc: Controls the focus state of this editor instance. ...

members.name: id
members.doc: A unique random string assigned to each editor instance in the page.

members.name: keystrokeHandler
members.doc: Controls keystrokes typing in this editor instance.

members.name: lang
members.doc:
An object that contains all language strings used by the editor interface.

alert( editor.lang.basicstyles.bold ); // e.g. 'Negrito' (if the language is set to Portuguese)
members.short_doc: An object that contains all language strings used by the editor interface. ...

members.name: langCode
members.doc:
The code for the language resources that have been loaded for the user interface elements of this editor instance.

alert( editor.langCode ); // e.g. 'en'
members.short_doc:
The code for the language resources that have been loaded
for the user interface elements of this editor instance. ...

members.name: mode
members.doc:
The current editing mode. An editing mode basically provides different ways of editing or viewing the contents.

alert( CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.mode ); // (e.g.) 'wysiwyg'
members.short_doc: The current editing mode. ...

members.name: name
members.doc:
A unique identifier of this editor instance.

Note: It will be originated from the ID or name attribute of the element, otherwise a name pattern of 'editor{n}' will be used.
members.short_doc: A unique identifier of this editor instance. ...

members.name: plugins
members.doc:
An object that contains references to all plugins used by this editor instance.

alert( editor.plugins.dialog.path ); // e.g. 'http://example.com/ckeditor/plugins/dialog/'

// Check if a plugin is available.
if ( editor.plugins.image ) {
    ...
}
members.short_doc:
An object that contains references to all plugins used by this
editor instance. ...

members.name: readOnly
members.doc: Indicates the read-only state of this editor. This is a read-only property.@see CKEDITOR.editor.setReadOnly
members.short_doc: Indicates the read-only state of this editor. ...

members.name: shiftEnterMode
members.doc: See the enterMode property.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Indicates editor initialization status. The following statuses are available:

  • unloaded: the initial state - editor's instance has been initialized, but its components (config, plugins, language files) are not loaded yet.
  • loaded: editor's components have been loaded - see loaded event.
  • ready: editor is fully initialized and ready - see instanceReady event.
  • destroyed: the editor has been destroyed - see destroy method.
members.short_doc: Indicates editor initialization status. ...

members.name: tabIndex
members.doc:
The tabbing navigation order determined for this editor instance. This can be set by the CKEDITOR.config.tabIndex setting or taken from the tabindex attribute of the element associated with the editor.

alert( editor.tabIndex ); // e.g. 0
members.short_doc: The tabbing navigation order determined for this editor instance. ...

members.name: templates
members.doc: Contains all UI templates created for this editor instance.
members.short_doc: Contains all UI templates created for this editor instance. ...

members.name: title
members.doc:
Indicates the human-readable title of this editor. Although this is a read-only property, it can be initialized with CKEDITOR.config.title.

Note: Please do not confuse this property with editor.name which identifies the instance in the CKEDITOR.instances literal.
members.short_doc: Indicates the human-readable title of this editor. ...

members.name: toolbar
members.doc: Toolbar definition used by the editor. It is crated from the CKEDITOR.config.toolbar if it is set or automatically based on CKEDITOR.config.toolbarGroups.
members.short_doc: Toolbar definition used by the editor. ...

members.name: ui
members.doc: Namespace containing UI features related to this editor instance.

members.name: widgets
members.doc:
An instance of widget repository. It contains all registered widget definitions and initialized instances.

editor.widgets.add( 'someName', {
    // Widget definition...
} );

editor.widgets.registered.someName; // -> Widget definition
members.short_doc: An instance of widget repository. ...

members.name: window
members.doc:
The window instance related to the document property.

It is always equal to the editor.document.getWindow().

See document property documentation.
members.short_doc: The window instance related to the document property. ...

members.name: constructor
members.doc: Creates an editor class instance.

params.name: element
params.doc: The DOM element upon which this editor will be created.

params.name: mode
params.doc: The element creation mode to be used by this editor.

members.short_doc: Creates an editor class instance. ...

members.name: _attachToForm
members.doc: Attaches the editor to a form to call updateElement before form submission. This method is called by both creators (replace and inline), so there is no reason to call it manually.
members.short_doc: Attaches the editor to a form to call updateElement before form submission. ...

members.name: addCommand
members.doc:
Adds a command definition to the editor instance. Commands added with this function can be executed later with the execCommand method.

    editorInstance.addCommand( 'sample', {
        exec: function( editor ) {
            alert( 'Executing a command for the editor name "' + editor.name + '"!' );
        }
    } );
members.short_doc: Adds a command definition to the editor instance. ...

members.name: addContentsCss
members.doc:
Adds the path to a stylesheet file to the exisiting CKEDITOR.config.contentsCss value.

Note: This method is available only with the wysiwygarea plugin and only affects classic editors based on it (so it does not affect inline editors).

editor.addContentsCss( 'assets/contents.css' );

params.name: cssPath
params.doc: The path to the stylesheet file which should be added.

members.short_doc: Adds the path to a stylesheet file to the exisiting CKEDITOR.config.contentsCss value. ...

members.name: addFeature
members.doc: Shorthand for CKEDITOR.filter.addFeature.
members.short_doc: Shorthand for CKEDITOR.filter.addFeature. ...

members.name: addMenuGroup
members.doc: Registers an item group to the editor context menu in order to make it possible to associate it with menu items later.

params.name: order
params.doc: Define the display sequence of this group inside the menu. A smaller value gets displayed first.

members.short_doc:
Registers an item group to the editor context menu in order to make it
possible to associate it with menu items later. ...

members.name: addMenuItem
members.doc: Adds an item from the specified definition to the editor context menu.
members.short_doc: Adds an item from the specified definition to the editor context menu. ...

members.name: addMenuItems
members.doc: Adds one or more items from the specified definition array to the editor context menu.

params.name: definitions
params.doc: List of definitions for each menu item as if addMenuItem is called.

members.short_doc: Adds one or more items from the specified definition array to the editor context menu. ...

members.name: addMode
members.doc: Registers an editing mode. This function is to be used mainly by plugins.

params.name: exec
params.doc: The function that performs the actual mode change.

members.short_doc: Registers an editing mode. ...

members.name: addRemoveFormatFilter
members.doc:
Add to a collection of functions to decide whether a specific element should be considered as formatting element and thus could be removed during removeFormat command.

Note: Only available with the existence of removeformat plugin.

// Don't remove empty span.
editor.addRemoveFormatFilter( function( element ) {
    return !( element.is( 'span' ) && CKEDITOR.tools.isEmpty( element.getAttributes() ) );
} );

params.name: func
params.doc: The function to be called, which will be passed a {CKEDITOR.dom.element} element to test.

members.short_doc:
Add to a collection of functions to decide whether a specific
element should be considered as formatting element and ...

members.name: applyStyle
members.doc: Applies the style upon the editor's current selection. Shorthand for CKEDITOR.style.apply.
members.short_doc: Applies the style upon the editor's current selection. ...

members.name: attachStyleStateChange
members.doc:
Registers a function to be called whenever the selection position changes in the editing area. The current state is passed to the function. The possible states are CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_ON and CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_OFF.

// Create a style object for the <b> element.
var style = new CKEDITOR.style( { element: 'b' } );
var editor = CKEDITOR.instances.editor1;
editor.attachStyleStateChange( style, function( state ) {
    if ( state == CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_ON )
        alert( 'The current state for the B element is ON' );
    else
        alert( 'The current state for the B element is OFF' );
} );
members.short_doc:
Registers a function to be called whenever the selection position changes in the
editing area. ...

members.name: capture
members.doc: Register event handler under the capturing stage on supported target.
members.short_doc: Register event handler under the capturing stage on supported target. ...

members.name: checkDirty
members.doc:
Checks whether the current editor contents present changes when compared to the contents loaded into the editor at startup, or to the contents available in the editor when resetDirty was called.

function beforeUnload( evt ) {
    if ( CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.checkDirty() )
        return evt.returnValue = "You will lose the changes made in the editor.";
}

if ( window.addEventListener )
    window.addEventListener( 'beforeunload', beforeUnload, false );
else
    window.attachEvent( 'onbeforeunload', beforeUnload );
members.short_doc:
Checks whether the current editor contents present changes when
compared to the contents loaded into the editor at st...

members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: createFakeParserElement
members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: createRange
members.doc: Shortcut to create a CKEDITOR.dom.range instance from the editable element.

return.name: return
return.doc: The dom range created if the editable has presented. @see CKEDITOR.dom.range

members.short_doc: Shortcut to create a CKEDITOR.dom.range instance from the editable element. ...

members.name: define
members.doc: Predefine some intrinsic properties on a specific event name.

properties.name: errorProof
properties.doc: Whether the event firing should catch error thrown from a per listener call.

members.short_doc: Predefine some intrinsic properties on a specific event name. ...

members.name: destroy
members.doc:
Destroys the editor instance, releasing all resources used by it. If the editor replaced an element, the element will be recovered.

alert( CKEDITOR.instances.editor1 ); // e.g. object
CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.destroy();
alert( CKEDITOR.instances.editor1 ); // undefined

params.name: noUpdate
params.doc: If the instance is replacing a DOM element, this parameter indicates whether or not to update the element with the instance contents.

members.short_doc: Destroys the editor instance, releasing all resources used by it. ...

members.name: editable
members.doc: Create, retrieve or detach an editable element of the editor, this method should always be used instead of calling directly CKEDITOR.editable.

params.name: elementOrEditable
params.doc: The DOM element to become the editable or a CKEDITOR.editable object.

members.short_doc:
Create, retrieve or detach an editable element of the editor,
this method should always be used instead of calling di...

members.name: elementPath
members.doc: Returns an element path for the selection in the editor.

params.name: startNode
params.doc: From which the path should start, if not specified default to editor selection's start element yield by CKEDITOR.dom.selection.getStartElement.

members.short_doc: Returns an element path for the selection in the editor. ...

members.name: execCommand
members.doc:
Executes a command associated with the editor.

editorInstance.execCommand( 'bold' );

params.name: data
params.doc: Data to be passed to the command.

return.name: return
return.doc: true if the command was executed successfully, otherwise false. @see CKEDITOR.editor.addCommand

members.short_doc: Executes a command associated with the editor. ...

members.name: fire
members.doc:
Fires an specific event in the object. All registered listeners are called at this point.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );
someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );             // Both listeners are called.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function( event ) {
    alert( event.data );                    // 'Example'
} );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent', 'Example' );

params.name: data
params.doc: Data to be sent as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.data when calling the listeners.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance to send as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.editor when calling the listener.

return.name: return
return.doc: A boolean indicating that the event is to be canceled, or data returned by one of the listeners.

members.short_doc: Fires an specific event in the object. ...

members.name: fireOnce
members.doc:
Fires an specific event in the object, releasing all listeners registered to that event. The same listeners are not called again on successive calls of it or of fire.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );         // Above listener called.
someObject.fireOnce( 'someEvent' );     // Above listener called.
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );         // No listeners called.

params.name: data
params.doc: Data to be sent as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.data when calling the listeners.

params.name: editor
params.doc: The editor instance to send as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.editor when calling the listener.

return.name: return
return.doc: A booloan indicating that the event is to be canceled, or data returned by one of the listeners.

members.short_doc:
Fires an specific event in the object, releasing all listeners
registered to that event. ...

members.name: focus
members.doc: Moves the selection focus to the editing area space in the editor.
members.short_doc: Moves the selection focus to the editing area space in the editor. ...

members.name: forceNextSelectionCheck
members.doc: @todo
members.short_doc: @todo ...

members.name: getClipboardData
members.doc:
Gets clipboard data by directly accessing the clipboard (IE only) or opening paste dialog.

editor.getClipboardData( { title: 'Get my data' }, function( data ) {
    if ( data )
        alert( data.type + ' ' + data.dataValue );
} );

params.name: callback
params.doc: Function that will be executed with data.type and data.dataValue or null if none of the capturing method succeeded.

members.short_doc: Gets clipboard data by directly accessing the clipboard (IE only) or opening paste dialog. ...

members.name: getColorFromDialog
members.doc: Open up color dialog and to receive the selected color.

params.name: callback
params.doc: The callback when color dialog is closed

properties.name: color
properties.doc: The color value received if selected on the dialog.

params.name: scope
params.doc: The scope in which the callback will be bound.

members.short_doc: Open up color dialog and to receive the selected color. ...

members.name: getCommand
members.doc: Gets one of the registered commands. Note that after registering a command definition with addCommand, it is transformed internally into an instance of CKEDITOR.command, which will then be returned by this function.

params.name: commandName
params.doc: The name of the command to be returned. This is the same name that is used to register the command with addCommand.

return.name: return
return.doc: The command object identified by the provided name.

members.short_doc: Gets one of the registered commands. ...

members.name: getData
members.doc:
Gets the editor data. The data will be in raw format. It is the same data that is posted by the editor.

if ( CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.getData() == '' )
    alert( 'There is no data available' );
members.short_doc: Gets the editor data. ...

members.name: getMenuItem
members.doc: Retrieves a particular menu item definition from the editor context menu.

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the desired menu item.

members.short_doc: Retrieves a particular menu item definition from the editor context menu. ...

members.name: getResizable
members.doc: Gets the element that can be used to check the editor size. This method is mainly used by the resize plugin, which adds a UI handle that can be used to resize the editor.

params.name: forContents
params.doc: Whether to return the "contents" part of the theme instead of the container.

members.short_doc: Gets the element that can be used to check the editor size. ...

members.name: getSelection
members.doc:
Retrieve the editor selection in scope of editable element.

Note: Since the native browser selection provides only one single selection at a time per document, so if editor's editable element has lost focus, this method will return a null value unless the lockSelection has been called beforehand so the saved selection is retrieved.

var selection = CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.getSelection();
alert( selection.getType() );

params.name: forceRealSelection
params.doc: Return real selection, instead of saved or fake one.

return.name: return
return.doc: A selection object or null if not available for the moment.

members.short_doc: Retrieve the editor selection in scope of editable element. ...

members.name: getSnapshot
members.doc:
Gets the "raw data" currently available in the editor. This is a fast method which returns the data as is, without processing, so it is not recommended to use it on resulting pages. Instead it can be used combined with the loadSnapshot method in order to be able to automatically save the editor data from time to time while the user is using the editor, to avoid data loss, without risking performance issues.

alert( editor.getSnapshot() );

@see CKEDITOR.editor.getData
members.short_doc: Gets the "raw data" currently available in the editor. ...

members.name: getStylesSet
members.doc:
Gets the current stylesSet for this instance.

editor.getStylesSet( function( stylesDefinitions ) {} );

See also stylesSet event.

params.name: callback
params.doc: The function to be called with the styles data.

members.short_doc: Gets the current stylesSet for this instance. ...

members.name: getUiColor
members.doc:
Gets the color of the editor user interface.

CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.getUiColor();

return.name: return
return.doc: uiColor The editor UI color or undefined if the UI color is not set.

members.short_doc: Gets the color of the editor user interface. ...

members.name: hasListeners
members.doc:
Checks if there is any listener registered to a given event.

var myListener = function() { ... };
someObject.on( 'someEvent', myListener );
alert( someObject.hasListeners( 'someEvent' ) );    // true
alert( someObject.hasListeners( 'noEvent' ) );      // false
members.short_doc: Checks if there is any listener registered to a given event. ...

members.name: insertElement
members.doc:
Inserts an element into the currently selected position in the editor in WYSIWYG mode.

var element = CKEDITOR.dom.element.createFromHtml( '<img src="hello.png" border="0" title="Hello" />' );
CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.insertElement( element );

params.name: element
params.doc: The element to be inserted into the editor.

members.short_doc:
Inserts an element into the currently selected position in the
editor in WYSIWYG mode. ...

members.name: insertHtml
members.doc:
Inserts HTML code into the currently selected position in the editor in WYSIWYG mode.

  • "html" - content being inserted will completely override styles of selected position.
  • "unfiltered_html" - like "html" but content isn't filtered with CKEDITOR.filter.
  • "text" - content being inserted will inherit styles applied in selected position. This mode should be used when inserting "htmlified" plain text (HTML without inline styles and styling elements like <b/>, <strong/>, <span style="..."/>).

Example:

CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.insertHtml( '<p>This is a new paragraph.</p>' );

params.name: html
params.doc: HTML code to be inserted into the editor.

params.name: mode
params.doc: Mode in which HTML will be inserted.

members.short_doc: Inserts HTML code into the currently selected position in the editor in WYSIWYG mode. ...

members.name: insertText
members.doc:
Insert text content into the currently selected position in the editor in WYSIWYG mode. The styles of the selected element will be applied to the inserted text. Spaces around the text will be leaving untouched.

CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.insertText( ' line1 \n\n line2' );

params.name: text
params.doc: Text to be inserted into the editor.

members.short_doc:
Insert text content into the currently selected position in the
editor in WYSIWYG mode. ...

members.name: loadSnapshot
members.doc:
Loads "raw data" into the editor. The data is loaded with processing straight to the editing area. It should not be used as a way to load any kind of data, but instead in combination with getSnapshot produced data.

var data = editor.getSnapshot();
editor.loadSnapshot( data );

@see CKEDITOR.editor.setData
members.short_doc: Loads "raw data" into the editor. ...

members.name: lockSelection
members.doc: Locks the selection made in the editor in order to make it possible to manipulate it without browser interference. A locked selection is cached and remains unchanged until it is released with the unlockSelection method.
members.short_doc:
Locks the selection made in the editor in order to make it possible to
manipulate it without browser interference. ...

members.name: on
members.doc:
Registers a listener to a specific event in the current object.

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() {
    alert( this == someObject );        // true
} );

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() {
    alert( this == anotherObject );     // true
}, anotherObject );

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function( event ) {
    alert( event.listenerData );        // 'Example'
}, null, 'Example' );

someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... } );                       // 2nd called
someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... }, null, null, 100 );      // 3rd called
someObject.on( 'someEvent', function() { ... }, null, null, 1 );        // 1st called

params.name: listenerFunction
params.doc: The function listening to the event. A single CKEDITOR.eventInfo object instanced is passed to this function containing all the event data.

params.name: scopeObj
params.doc: The object used to scope the listener call (the this object). If omitted, the current object is used.

params.name: listenerData
params.doc: Data to be sent as the CKEDITOR.eventInfo.listenerData when calling the listener.

params.name: priority
params.doc: The listener priority. Lower priority listeners are called first. Listeners with the same priority value are called in registration order.

return.name: return
return.doc: An object containing the removeListener function, which can be used to remove the listener at any time.

members.short_doc: Registers a listener to a specific event in the current object. ...

members.name: once
members.doc:
Similiar with on but the listener will be called only once upon the next event firing.

@see CKEDITOR.event.on
members.short_doc: Similiar with on but the listener will be called only once upon the next event firing. ...

members.name: openDialog
members.doc:
Loads and opens a registered dialog.

CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.openDialog( 'smiley' );

params.name: callback
params.doc: The function to be invoked after dialog instance created.

return.name: return
return.doc: The dialog object corresponding to the dialog displayed. null if the dialog name is not registered. @see CKEDITOR.dialog.add

members.short_doc: Loads and opens a registered dialog. ...

members.name: popup
members.doc: Opens Browser in a popup. The width and height parameters accept numbers (pixels) or percent (of screen size) values.

params.name: url
params.doc: The url of the external file browser.

members.short_doc: Opens Browser in a popup. ...

members.name: removeAllListeners
members.doc: Remove all existing listeners on this object, for cleanup purpose.
members.short_doc: Remove all existing listeners on this object, for cleanup purpose. ...

members.name: removeListener
members.doc:
Unregisters a listener function from being called at the specified event. No errors are thrown if the listener has not been registered previously.

var myListener = function() { ... };
someObject.on( 'someEvent', myListener );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );                 // myListener called.
someObject.removeListener( 'someEvent', myListener );
someObject.fire( 'someEvent' );                 // myListener not called.
members.short_doc:
Unregisters a listener function from being called at the specified
event. ...

members.name: removeMenuItem
members.doc: Removes a particular menu item added before from the editor context menu.

params.name: name
params.doc: The name of the desired menu item.

members.short_doc: Removes a particular menu item added before from the editor context menu. ...

members.name: removeStyle
members.doc: Removes the style from the editor's current selection. Shorthand for CKEDITOR.style.remove.
members.short_doc: Removes the style from the editor's current selection. ...

members.name: resetDirty
members.doc:
Resets the "dirty state" of the editor so subsequent calls to checkDirty will return false if the user will not have made further changes to the contents.

alert( editor.checkDirty() ); // e.g. true
editor.resetDirty();
alert( editor.checkDirty() ); // false
members.short_doc:
Resets the "dirty state" of the editor so subsequent calls to
checkDirty will return false if the user will not
have ...

members.name: resetUndo
members.doc: Resets the undo stack.
members.short_doc: Resets the undo stack. ...

members.name: resize
members.doc:
Resizes the editor interface.

editor.resize( 900, 300 );

editor.resize( '100%', 450, true );

params.name: width
params.doc: The new width. It can be an integer denoting a value in pixels or a CSS size value with unit.

params.name: height
params.doc: The new height. It can be an integer denoting a value in pixels or a CSS size value with unit.

params.name: isContentHeight
params.doc: Indicates that the provided height is to be applied to the editor content area, and not to the entire editor interface. Defaults to false.

params.name: resizeInner
params.doc: Indicates that it is the inner interface element that must be resized, not the outer element. The default theme defines the editor interface inside a pair of <span> elements (<span><span>...</span></span>). By default the first, outer <span> element receives the sizes. If this parameter is set to true, the second, inner <span> is resized instead.

members.short_doc: Resizes the editor interface. ...

members.name: selectionChange
members.doc: Check the selection change in editor and potentially fires the selectionChange event.

params.name: checkNow
params.doc: Force the check to happen immediately instead of coming with a timeout delay (default).

members.short_doc:
Check the selection change in editor and potentially fires
the selectionChange event. ...

members.name: setActiveEnterMode
members.doc:
Sets the active enter modes (enterMode and shiftEnterMode). Fires the activeEnterModeChange event.

Prior to CKEditor 4.3 enter modes were static and it was enough to check CKEDITOR.config.enterMode and CKEDITOR.config.shiftEnterMode when implementing a feature which should depend on the enter modes. Since CKEditor 4.3 these options are source of initial:

  • static enterMode and shiftEnterMode values,
  • dynamic activeEnterMode and activeShiftEnterMode values.

However, the dynamic enter modes can be changed during runtime by using this method, to reflect the selection context. For example, if selection is moved to the widget's nested editable which is a blockless one, then the active enter modes should be changed to CKEDITOR.ENTER_BR (in this case Widget System takes care of that).

Note: This method should not be used to configure editor – use CKEDITOR.config.enterMode and CKEDITOR.config.shiftEnterMode instead. This method should be used only to dynamically change enter modes during runtime based on selection changes. Keep in mind that changed enter mode may be overwritten by other plugin/feature when it decided that the changed context requires this.

Note: In case of blockless editor (inline editor based on element which cannot contain block elements – see blockless) only CKEDITOR.ENTER_BR is a valid enter mode. Therefore this method will not allow to set other values.

Note: Changing the active filter may cause enter mode change if default enter modes are not allowed by the new filter.

params.name: enterMode
params.doc: One of CKEDITOR.ENTER_P, CKEDITOR.ENTER_DIV, CKEDITOR.ENTER_BR. Pass falsy value (e.g. null) to reset enter mode to the default value (enterMode and/or shiftEnterMode).

members.short_doc: Sets the active enter modes (enterMode and shiftEnterMode). ...

members.name: setActiveFilter
members.doc:
Sets the active filter (activeFilter). Fires activeFilterChange event.

// Set active filter which allows only 4 elements.
// Buttons like Bold, Italic will be disabled.
var filter = new CKEDITOR.filter( 'p strong em br' );
editor.setActiveFilter( filter );

Setting new filter will also change the active enter modes to the first values allowed by the new filter (see CKEDITOR.filter.getAllowedEnterMode).

params.name: filter
params.doc: Filter instance or a falsy value (e.g. null) to reset to the default one.

members.short_doc: Sets the active filter (activeFilter). ...

members.name: setData
members.doc:
Sets the editor data. The data must be provided in the raw format (HTML).

Note that this method is asynchronous. The callback parameter must be used if interaction with the editor is needed after setting the data.

CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.setData( '<p>This is the editor data.</p>' );

CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.setData( '<p>Some other editor data.</p>', function() {
    this.checkDirty(); // true
});

params.name: data
params.doc: HTML code to replace the curent content in the editor.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Function to be called after the setData is completed.

params.name: internal
params.doc: Whether to suppress any event firing when copying data internally inside the editor.

members.short_doc: Sets the editor data. ...

members.name: setKeystroke
members.doc:
Assigns keystrokes associated to editor commands.

editor.setKeystroke( CKEDITOR.CTRL + 115, 'save' ); // Assigned CTRL+S to "save" command.
editor.setKeystroke( CKEDITOR.CTRL + 115, false );  // Disabled CTRL+S keystroke assignment.
editor.setKeystroke( [
    [ CKEDITOR.ALT + 122, false ],
    [ CKEDITOR.CTRL + 121, 'link' ],
    [ CKEDITOR.SHIFT + 120, 'bold' ]
] );

This method may be used in the following cases:

  • By plugins (like link or basicstyles) to set their keystrokes when plugins are being loaded.
  • During the runtime to modify existing keystrokes.

The editor handles keystroke configuration in the following order:

  1. Plugins use this method to define default keystrokes.
  2. Editor extends default keystrokes with CKEDITOR.config.keystrokes.
  3. Editor blocks keystrokes defined in CKEDITOR.config.blockedKeystrokes.

After all, you can still set new keystrokes using this method during the runtime.

params.name: keystroke
params.doc: Keystroke or an array of keystroke definitions.

params.name: behavior
params.doc: A command to be executed on the keystroke.

members.short_doc: Assigns keystrokes associated to editor commands. ...

members.name: setMode
members.doc:
Changes the editing mode of this editor instance.

Note: The mode switch could be asynchronous depending on the mode provider. Use the callback to hook subsequent code.

// Switch to "source" view.
CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.setMode( 'source' );
// Switch to "wysiwyg" view and be notified on completion.
CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.setMode( 'wysiwyg', function() { alert( 'wysiwyg mode loaded!' ); } );

params.name: newMode
params.doc: If not specified, the CKEDITOR.config.startupMode will be used.

params.name: callback
params.doc: Optional callback function which is invoked once the mode switch has succeeded.

members.short_doc: Changes the editing mode of this editor instance. ...

members.name: setReadOnly
members.doc:
Puts or restores the editor into read-only state. When in read-only, the user is not able to change the editor contents, but can still use some editor features. This function sets the readOnly property of the editor, firing the readOnly event.

Note: the current editing area will be reloaded.

params.name: isReadOnly
params.doc: Indicates that the editor must go read-only (true, default) or be restored and made editable (false).

members.short_doc: Puts or restores the editor into read-only state. ...

members.name: setUiColor
members.doc:
Sets the color of the editor user interface. This method accepts a color value in hexadecimal notation, with a # character (e.g. #ffffff).

    CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.setUiColor( '#ff00ff' );

params.name: color
params.doc: The desired editor UI color in hexadecimal notation.

members.short_doc: Sets the color of the editor user interface. ...

members.name: unlockSelection
members.doc: Unlocks the selection made in the editor and locked with the unlockSelection method. An unlocked selection is no longer cached and can be changed.

params.name: restore
params.doc: If set to true, the selection is restored back to the selection saved earlier by using the CKEDITOR.dom.selection.lock method.

members.short_doc:
Unlocks the selection made in the editor and locked with the
unlockSelection method. ...

members.name: updateElement
members.doc:
Updates the <textarea> element that was replaced by the editor with the current data available in the editor.

Note: This method will only affect those editor instances created with CKEDITOR.ELEMENT_MODE_REPLACE element mode or inline instances bound to <textarea> elements.

CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.updateElement();
alert( document.getElementById( 'editor1' ).value ); // The current editor data.

@see CKEDITOR.editor.element
members.short_doc:
Updates the <textarea> element that was replaced by the editor with
the current data available in the editor. ...

members.doc: Fired before the command execution when execCommand is called.

properties.name: commandData
properties.doc: The data to be sent to the command. This can be manipulated by the event listener.

members.short_doc: Fired before the command execution when execCommand is called. ...

members.name: beforeGetData
members.doc: Internal event to get the current data.
members.short_doc: Internal event to get the current data. ...

members.name: beforeModeUnload
members.doc: Fired before changing the editing mode. See also beforeSetMode and mode.
members.short_doc: Fired before changing the editing mode. ...

members.name: beforePaste
members.doc:
Fired before the paste event. Allows to preset data type.

Note: This event is deprecated. Add a 0 priority listener for the paste event instead.

members.name: beforeSetMode
members.doc: Fired before the editor mode is set. See also mode and beforeModeUnload.

params.name: data

members.short_doc: Fired before the editor mode is set. ...

members.name: beforeUndoImage
members.doc: Fired before an undo image is to be taken. An undo image represents the editor state at some point. It is saved into the undo store, so the editor is able to recover the editor state on undo and redo operations.
members.short_doc: Fired before an undo image is to be taken. ...

members.name: blur
members.doc:
Fired when the editor instance loses the input focus.

Note: This event will NOT be triggered when focus is moved internally, e.g. from the editable to other part of the editor UI like dialog. If you're interested on only the editable focus state listen to the CKEDITOR.editable.focus and CKEDITOR.editable.blur events instead.

editor.on( 'blur', function( e ) {
    alert( 'The editor named ' + e.editor.name + ' lost the focus' );
} );
members.short_doc: Fired when the editor instance loses the input focus. ...

members.name: change
members.doc:
Fired when the content of the editor is changed.

Due to performance reasons, it is not verified if the content really changed. The editor instead watches several editing actions that usually result in changes. This event may thus in some cases be fired when no changes happen or may even get fired twice.

If it is important not to get the change event too often, you should compare the previous and the current editor content inside the event listener.
members.short_doc: Fired when the content of the editor is changed. ...

members.name: configLoaded
members.doc: Fired once the editor configuration is ready (loaded and processed).
members.short_doc: Fired once the editor configuration is ready (loaded and processed). ...

members.name: contentDirChanged
members.doc: Fired when the language direction in the specific cursor position is changed
members.short_doc: Fired when the language direction in the specific cursor position is changed ...

members.name: contentDom
members.doc:
Fired when content of the editor (its DOM structure) is ready. It is similar to native DOMContentLoaded event, but it concerns editor's content. It is also a first event fired after CKEDITOR.editable is initialized.

This event is particularly important for classic (iframe-based) editor, because on editor initialization and every time data are set (by setData) contents DOM structure is rebuilt. Thus, e.g. you need to attach DOM events listeners on editable one more time.

On inline editor this event is fired only once - when editor is initialized for the first time. That's because setting editor's content doesn't cause editable destruction and creation.

contentDom goes along with contentDomUnload which is fired before contents DOM structure is destroyed. This is the right moment to detach content DOM events listener. Otherwise browsers like IE or Opera may throw exceptions when accessing elements from detached document.

Note: CKEDITOR.editable.attachListener is a convenient way to attach listeners that will be detached on contentDomUnload.

editor.on( 'contentDom', function() {
    var editable = editor.editable();

    editable.attachListener( editable, 'click', function() {
        console.log( 'Editable has been clicked' );
    });
});
members.short_doc: Fired when content of the editor (its DOM structure) is ready. ...

members.name: contentDomInvalidated
members.doc: The event fired when contents DOM changes and some of the references as well as native DOM event listeners could be lost. This event is useful when it is important to keep track of references to elements in the editable contents from code.
members.short_doc:
The event fired when contents DOM changes and some of the references as well as
native DOM event listeners could be l...

members.name: contentDomUnload
members.doc: Fired before contents DOM structure is destroyed. See contentDom documentation for more details.
members.short_doc: Fired before contents DOM structure is destroyed. ...

members.name: customConfigLoaded
members.doc:
Fired when the custom configuration file is loaded, before the final configurations initialization.

Custom configuration files can be loaded thorugh the CKEDITOR.config.customConfig setting. Several files can be loaded by changing this setting.
members.short_doc:
Fired when the custom configuration file is loaded, before the final
configurations initialization. ...

members.name: dataFiltered
members.doc:
This event is fired when CKEDITOR.filter has stripped some content from the data that was loaded (e.g. by setData method or in the source mode) or inserted (e.g. when pasting or using the insertHtml method).

This event is useful when testing whether the CKEDITOR.config.allowedContent setting is sufficient and correct for a system that is migrating to CKEditor 4.1 (where the Advanced Content Filter was introduced).
members.short_doc:
This event is fired when CKEDITOR.filter has stripped some
content from the data that was loaded (e.g. ...

members.short_doc: Fired as an indicator of the editor data loading. ...

members.doc: Fired when this editor instance is destroyed. The editor at this point is not usable and this event should be used to perform the clean-up in any plugin.

Fired when the editor instance receives the input focus.

editor.on( 'focus', function( e ) {

} );
members.short_doc: Fired when the editor instance receives the input focus. ...

members.short_doc: Internal event to perform the insertText call. ...

members.short_doc:
Fired when the CKEDITOR instance is completely created, fully initialized
and ready for interaction. ...

members.name: key
members.doc:
Fired when any keyboard key (or combination) is pressed into the editing area.

editor.on( 'key', function( evt ) {
    if ( evt.data.keyCode == CKEDITOR.CTRL + 90 ) {
        // Do something...

        // Cancel the event, so other listeners won't be executed and
        // keydown's default behavior will be prevented.
        evt.cancel();
    }
} );

Usually you'll want to use the setKeystroke method or the CKEDITOR.config.keystrokes option to attach a keystroke to some command. Key event listeners are usuful when some action should be executed conditionally, based for example on precise selection location.

properties.name: keyCode
properties.doc: A number representing the key code (or combination). It is the sum of the current key code and the CKEDITOR.CTRL, CKEDITOR.SHIFT and CKEDITOR.ALT constants, if those are pressed.

properties.name: domEvent
properties.doc: A keydown DOM event instance. Available since CKEditor 4.4.1.

members.short_doc: Fired when any keyboard key (or combination) is pressed into the editing area. ...

members.name: langLoaded
members.doc: Fired when the language is loaded into the editor instance.
members.short_doc: Fired when the language is loaded into the editor instance. ...

members.name: loadSnapshot
members.doc: Internal event to perform the loadSnapshot call.
members.short_doc: Internal event to perform the loadSnapshot call. ...

members.name: loaded
members.doc: Fired when editor's components (config, languages and plugins) are fully loaded and initialized. However, the editor will be fully ready to for interaction on instanceReady.
members.short_doc:
Fired when editor's components (config, languages and plugins) are fully
loaded and initialized. ...

members.name: lockSnapshot
members.doc:
Locks the undo manager to prevent any save/update operations.

It is convenient to lock the undo manager before performing DOM operations that should not be recored (e.g. auto paragraphing).

See CKEDITOR.plugins.undo.UndoManager.lock for more details.

Note: In order to unlock the undo manager, unlockSnapshot has to be fired the same number of times that lockSnapshot has been fired.

properties.name: dontUpdate
properties.doc: When set to true, the last snapshot will not be updated with the current content and selection. Read more in the CKEDITOR.plugins.undo.UndoManager.lock method.

properties.name: forceUpdate
properties.doc: When set to true, the last snapshot will always be updated with the current content and selection. Read more in the CKEDITOR.plugins.undo.UndoManager.lock method.

members.short_doc: Locks the undo manager to prevent any save/update operations. ...

members.name: maximize
members.doc: Event fired when the maximize command is called. It also indicates whether an editor is maximized or not.

params.name: data
params.doc: Current state of the command. See CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_ON and CKEDITOR.TRISTATE_OFF.

members.short_doc: Event fired when the maximize command is called. ...

members.doc: Fired when a menu is shown.
members.short_doc: Fired when a menu is shown. ...

members.name: mode
members.doc: Fired after setting the editing mode. See also beforeSetMode and beforeModeUnload
members.short_doc: Fired after setting the editing mode. ...

members.name: paste
members.doc: Fired when a clipboard operation is about to be taken into the editor. Listeners can manipulate the data to be pasted before having it effectively inserted into the document.

properties.name: type
properties.doc: Type of data in data.dataValue. Usually html or text, but for listeners with priority less than 6 it may be also auto, what means that content type hasn't been recognised yet (this will be done by content type sniffer that listens with priority 6).

members.short_doc: Fired when a clipboard operation is about to be taken into the editor. ...

members.short_doc: Internal event to open the Paste dialog. ...

members.short_doc: Internal event to pass paste dialog's data to the listeners. ...

members.doc: Fired when all plugins are loaded and initialized into the editor instance.
members.short_doc: Fired when all plugins are loaded and initialized into the editor instance. ...

members.name: readOnly
members.doc: Event fired after the readOnly property changes.
members.short_doc: Event fired after the readOnly property changes. ...

members.name: removeFormatCleanup
members.doc: Fired after an element was cleaned by the removeFormat plugin.
members.short_doc: Fired after an element was cleaned by the removeFormat plugin. ...

members.name: required
members.doc:
Fired when the editor (replacing a <textarea> which has a required attribute) is empty during form submission.

This event replaces native required fields validation that the browsers cannot perform when CKEditor replaces <textarea> elements.

You can cancel this event to prevent the page from submitting data.

editor.on( 'required', function( evt ) {
    alert( 'Article content is required.' );
    evt.cancel();
} );
members.short_doc: Fired when the editor (replacing a <textarea> which has a required attribute) is empty during form submission. ...

members.name: resize
members.doc: Fired after the editor instance is resized through the CKEDITOR.resize method.
members.short_doc:
Fired after the editor instance is resized through
the CKEDITOR.resize method. ...

members.name: save
members.doc: Fired when the user clicks the Save button on the editor toolbar. This event allows to overwrite the default Save button behavior.
members.short_doc: Fired when the user clicks the Save button on the editor toolbar. ...

members.name: saveSnapshot
members.doc: Fired when the editor is about to save an undo snapshot. This event can be fired by plugins and customizations to make the editor save undo snapshots.
members.short_doc: Fired when the editor is about to save an undo snapshot. ...

members.name: selectionChange
members.doc: Fired when selection inside editor has been changed. Note that this event is fired only when selection's start element (container of a selecion start) changes, not on every possible selection change. Thanks to that selectionChange is fired less frequently, but on every context (the elements path holding selection's start) change.
members.short_doc: Fired when selection inside editor has been changed. ...

members.name: setData
members.doc: Event fired before the setData call is executed allowing additional manipulation.
members.short_doc: Event fired before the setData call is executed allowing additional manipulation. ...

members.name: stylesSet
members.doc: Fired when styles set is loaded. During editor initialization phase the getStylesSet method returns only styles that are already loaded, which may not include e.g. styles parsed by stylesheetparser plugin. Thus, to be notified when all styles are ready you can listen on this event.
members.short_doc: Fired when styles set is loaded. ...

members.name: template
members.doc: Event fired when an UI template is added to the editor instance. It makes it possible to bring customizations to the template source.
members.short_doc: Event fired when an UI template is added to the editor instance. ...

members.name: toDataFormat
members.doc:
This event is fired when CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor is converting internal HTML to output data HTML.

By adding listeners with different priorities it is possible to process input HTML on different stages:

  • 1-4: Data is available in the original string format.
  • 5: Data is initially filtered with regexp patterns and parsed to CKEDITOR.htmlParser.fragment CKEDITOR.htmlParser.element.
  • 5-9: Data is available in the parsed format, but CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor.htmlFilter is not applied yet.
  • 10: Data is filtered with CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor.htmlFilter.
  • 11: Data is filtered with the {CKEDITOR.filter content filter} (on output the content filter makes only transformations, without filtering).
  • 10-14: Data is available in the parsed format and CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor.htmlFilter has already been applied.
  • 15: Data is written back to an HTML string.
  • 15-*: Data is available in an HTML string.

For example to be able to process parsed and already processed data add listener this way:

editor.on( 'toDataFormat', function( evt) {
    evt.data.dataValue; // -> CKEDITOR.htmlParser.fragment instance
}, null, null, 12 );
members.short_doc:
This event is fired when CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor is converting
internal HTML to output data HTML. ...

members.name: toHtml
members.doc:
This event is fired by the CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor when input HTML is to be purified by the CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor.toHtml method.

By adding listeners with different priorities it is possible to process input HTML on different stages:

  • 1-4: Data is available in the original string format.
  • 5: Data is initially filtered with regexp patterns and parsed to CKEDITOR.htmlParser.fragment CKEDITOR.htmlParser.element.
  • 5-9: Data is available in the parsed format, but CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor.dataFilter is not applied yet.
  • 6: Data is filtered with the {CKEDITOR.filter content filter}.
  • 10: Data is processed with CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor.dataFilter.
  • 10-14: Data is available in the parsed format and CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor.dataFilter has already been applied.
  • 15: Data is written back to an HTML string.
  • 15-*: Data is available in an HTML string.

For example to be able to process parsed, but not yet filtered data add listener this way:

editor.on( 'toHtml', function( evt) {
    evt.data.dataValue; // -> CKEDITOR.htmlParser.fragment instance
}, null, null, 7 );
members.short_doc:
This event is fired by the CKEDITOR.htmlDataProcessor when input HTML
is to be purified by the CKEDITOR.htmlDataProce...

members.name: unlockSnapshot
members.doc: Unlocks the undo manager and updates the latest snapshot.
members.short_doc: Unlocks the undo manager and updates the latest snapshot. ...

members.name: updateSnapshot
members.doc:
Amends the top of the undo stack (last undo image) with the current DOM changes.

function() {
    editor.fire( 'saveSnapshot' );
    editor.document.body.append(...);
    // Makes new changes following the last undo snapshot a part of it.
    editor.fire( 'updateSnapshot' );
    ..
}
members.short_doc: Amends the top of the undo stack (last undo image) with the current DOM changes. ...

members.name: widgetDefinition
members.doc: An event fired when a widget definition is registered by the CKEDITOR.plugins.widget.repository.add method. It is possible to modify the definition being registered.
members.short_doc: An event fired when a widget definition is registered by the CKEDITOR.plugins.widget.repository.add method. ...
